definition: well qualified/competent/to be equal to the task/able to do sth very well

sentences.english: Raj: Y've been a sucky friend, a sucky, sucky friend.
sentences.chinese: 听着，我承认我并非一直是个称职的朋友。

sentences.english: And some of our federal lawmakers and administrators are good and decent souls.
sentences.chinese: 我们联邦政府的一些管理者和立法者也都是称职的。

sentences.english: Ms. Huang said China suffers from a serious lack of qualified psychiatrists.
sentences.chinese: 但是，黄博士说中国严重缺乏称职的心理医生。

sentences.english: I'm sure that the misfit exists in states across the country and the underreporting exists, " he said."
sentences.chinese: “我相信，称职的国家存在全国和漏报存在，”他说。

sentences.english: Working for an incompetent boss can be bad for your health.
sentences.chinese: 为一个不称职的老板工作，可能对健康不利。

sentences.english: Even so, Afghan government forces are unreliable and incompetent.
sentences.chinese: 即便如此，阿富汗政府军还是靠不住而又不称职的。

sentences.english: I have long prided myself on being a good teacher.
sentences.chinese: 我一向以身为一名称职的老师师而自豪。

sentences.english: My two bunnies were really qualified guard.
The employee was dismissed as incompetent.
sentences.chinese: 该雇员被认为不称职而遭辞退。

sentences.english: She was a wonderful sister, a wonderful daughter, wonderful aunt.
sentences.chinese: 她是非常称职的姐姐，是乖女儿和好姨妈。

sentences.english: He is quite modest though he be a leading cadre.
sentences.chinese: 这位青年干部非常称职。

sentences.english: The clothes made of this magic cloth would be invisible to anyone who was unfit for the office he held.
sentences.chinese: 用这种魔布制成的衣服，那些不称职的人是看不见的。

sentences.english: What makes a good headmaster at a local school?
sentences.chinese: 在学校又如何做一个称职的校长？
那么一名称职的解说员应当具备哪些条件呢？

sentences.english: Being good little scientists, they trotted out their  spectroscopic equipment and examined the chemical signatures of five different vodkas.
sentences.chinese: 于是这些可爱称职的科学家们拿出光谱仪器开始考察。

sentences.english: Lowell, who succeeded him in the chair, also merited the appointment .
sentences.chinese: 接替他出任这个职位的洛威尔也极其称职。

definition: to do one's duty/to do one's bit conscientiously
(said of sb else's wife) a good wife
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to take responsibility/to bear responsibility/to be responsible
(to play) one's part/one's role/one's duty/(to stay within) one's bounds/dutiful/keeping to one's role
lit. arm-flinging shopkeeper/fig. sb who asks others to work but does nothing himself
special duty/assigned full time to a task
